page.title: 09Home Life In Northill
page.content: There are some{families with several {generations}living in proximity, but the trend is for outsiders to move into the region. Since the closure of the shop and Post Office, facilities are limited to mobile units or road- side stalls selling farm produce. Most families make weekly or monthly{shop- {ping}trips to supermarkets in the nearby towns. In this area,{food}is cooked mainly by electricity, and most {family meals}are taken in the evening. {Milk}is delivered daily;{refuse}is collected weekly (in plastic bags);the postlady delivers{mail}by bicycle. Many{homes}are centrally heated & well furnished with telephones connected. In most, music is played, television watched, newspapers & books read, and, in some, school work attempted. A good proportion of local families own{pets, and dogs are exercised along the lanes
